column4: same issue... is there somewhere else i have to change the kernel besides menu.lst?
remove /boot from the kernel line
I did.
should I try it with boot...?
I saw that to so I removed boot from the line.
not sure what to say, what error is grub giving you?
No idea, im doing this with VM so unless its logging the errors..?
usually I wouldn't but I have my server elsewhere in my house.
and only one keyboard and mouse set
how do you know that it isn't working then, does it just not boot?
uname -a reports a different version number - the generic kernel on the list.
what kernel source did you download?
http://wiki.fragaholics.de/index.php/EN:Linux_Kernel_Optimization
so the ones listed there in wget
with a patch.
it is probably the correct kernel, but you didn't change the version string in one of the files in the kernel source folder
I don't have a kernel source at the moment, and the name of the file escapes me
I don't think its loading the correct kernel... you might be right, but I'm not sure.
thanks for taking your time and helping out though, not sure whats wrong here myself
I think I might need to set the kernel somewhere else as wwell.
well*

got a kernel source, the version string is configured in the Makefile at the root of the kernel source folder, that is the version info that it printed in uname -a, I would check that, perhaps add some extra info (like -custom) to EXTRAVERSION and then rebuild the kernel and try that
Is there any way I can confirm it is loading the correct kernel?
